text:
Sony world photography awards 2017 shortlist   View more sharing options Share   Close 
The shortlisted and commended entries for all categories of the Sony world photography awards will be announced on Tuesday. More than 227,000 images from 183 countries were submitted and the winners will be revealed on 20 April
Tuesday 28 February 2017 08.00 GMT 
Daily life category, professional shortlist 
‘Inhabitants of the empty’. Syuzanna sits in a shelter made from an old car in front of the abandoned building where she lives in Gyumri, Armenia Photograph: Yulia Grigoryants
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Daily life category, professional shortlist 
‘A country doctor and her calling’. Family doctor Floarea Ciupitu visits a house in the village of Gângiova in south-west Romania, where she has worked for the past three decades Photograph: Ioana Moldovan
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Culture category, open shortlist 
‘Georgian baptism’. An infant is baptised according to the Orthodox rite in a church in Tbilisi, Georgia Photograph: Beniamino Pisati
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Culture category, open shortlist 
‘Mourning ceremony’, pictured in Iran Photograph: Emrah Karakoç
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Wildlife category, open shortlist 
‘Buffaloes and stars’. This picture, taken at Zimanga game reserve in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa, used an in-camera multiple exposure, with the first lit for the buffaloes and the second focused on the stars Photograph: Andreas Hemb
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Portraiture category, professional shortlist 
‘Hamza & Shukra’, from the series Racism in India: the African Portraits Photograph: Mahesh Shantaram
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Portraiture category, open shortlist 
‘Present and past’ shows 85-year-old Carmen Sajeras, born in Cuba from a family of Spanish immigrants Photograph: Anisleidy Martínez Fonseca,
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Portraiture category, professional shortlist 
‘Raul Rodrigues Jr’ in Apple Valley, California, US. Photographers Edoardo Delille and Giulia Piermartiri went on the road to meet Latinos pledging their vote to Donald Trump Photograph: Giulia Piermartiri & Edoardo Delille
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Current affairs and news category, professional shortlist 
‘Caught in the crossfire.’ Iraqi men from the Hawija region wait to be questioned by Kurdish security personnel at a base near Kirkuk, Iraq Photograph: Ivor Prickett
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Current affairs and news category, professional shortlist 
‘We are taking no prisoners’. Libyan forces affiliated to the Tripoli government walk around a huge chandelier at the Ouagadougou congress complex in Sirte, Libya Photograph: Alessio Romenzi
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Sport category, professional shortlist 
‘Pumping iron in Russia’. Participants wait backstage during a regional bodybuilding championship in Stavropol, southern Russia Photograph: Eduard Korniyenko
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Nature category, open shortlist 
‘Diamond-dust.’ A picture taken in Nagano-ken, Japan, at an altitude of about 1,700 metres. Diamond dust can be seen on only a few occasions during the cold season Photograph: Masayasu Sakuma
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Travel category, open shortlist 
‘Lady in red’, shot with a drone on the eastern part of the Luštica peninsula in Montenegro Photograph: Placido Faranda
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Street photography category, open shortlist 
‘Metropolis’. A reflection in a window interrupts a street scene Photograph: Tavepong Pratoomwong
Facebook Twitter Pinterest 
Still life category, open shortlist 
‘Palm trees routine’ was shot during a visit to the Muralla Roja residential complex in Alicante, Spain Photograph: Andrés Gallardo Albajar
